context_bundle.summary: GitOps is a modern framework for continuous delivery that uses Git as the single source of truth for declarative infrastructure and applications

onboarding.quick_start: git clone git@github.com:org/infrastructure.git && cd infrastructure && kubectl apply -f k8s/ && git commit -am 'Updated deployment version' && git push origin main
common_patterns: Declarative configs: All resources defined in YAML with apiVersion, kind, and metadata
Version control: '.gitignore' for secrets, track all manifests in git repository
Pull request workflow: 'git checkout -b feature-branch && git commit && git push origin feature-branch' for changes
Automated sync: ArgoCD or Flux controller watching git repository and applying changes to cluster
Environment promotion: 'git checkout -b production && git merge main && git push origin production' for promotion
Rollback: 'git revert <commit-hash>' and controllers automatically revert infrastructure state
known_errors: Sync failed: 'kubectl get events --sort-by=.metadata.creationTimestamp' and check for webhook admission errors
Drift detected: 'git diff HEAD && kubectl diff -f k8s/' to identify manual changes vs git state
Merge conflicts: 'git pull --rebase origin main' to resolve conflicts before pushing changes
Secrets in git: 'git filter-branch --force --index-filter' to remove committed secrets and implement encryption
RBAC issues: 'kubectl auth can-i create deployments' and verify service account permissions for automated sync
